feed.title: Combined summary - Fwd: [Bug 24444] Named Curve Registry (adding secp256k1)

entry.title: Combined summary - Fwd: [Bug 24444] Named Curve Registry (adding secp256k1)
entry.summary: An issue was filed for adding secp256k1 into the Web Crypto API, which will be implemented natively in some web browsers. Myron Davis reopened the issue and requested feedback from crypto implementers since secp256k1 is supported in several SSL/TLS libraries such as Botan, NSS, openssl, LibreSSL, PolarSSL, and JSSE. The other three curves have parameters that do not define how they were generated. On the other hand, the secp256k1 curve has advantages in faster signature verification and how the values were determined for the curve. With the discovery of backdoors in NIST's random number generator, there is a need for a determined parameter curve instead of a "random" curve option.The bug related to adding secp256k1 will be addressed by the extension bug 25618 if none objects before the 20th of Oct @20:00 UTC. Matt Corallo added a related bug on Curve25519 and some MS Research curves that generated far more discussion. If readers have any feedback from crypto implementers, they can add comments to the thread provided. The email thread includes links to related bugs on Curve25519 and some MS Research curves that generated far more discussion.
